intro: Sibara runcinata var. typica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sibara, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly China and Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and has a compact, herbaceous growth habit. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. The species is noted for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional herbal remedies.
